intro: Cryptantha scabrella, commonly known as the scabrous cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has hairy, sometimes scabrous stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open grasslands and along streambanks. Cryptantha scabrella is a perennial species that plays a role in stabilizing soil in arid environments.
